ML_AA_NAMES.AA_NAME: NHS England (North) Cumbria and the North East

ADDRESS_CONTRACTING_BODY.OFFICIALNAME: NHS England (North) Cumbria and the North East

SHORT_DESCR.P: NHS England has procured a range of healthcare service provisions for HMP Haverigg. There are 5 procurements for healthcare services at the moment. These services include:
— General Practitioner (GP) Services,
— Mental Health Services,
— Pharmacy Services,
— Primary Care Dental Services,
— DART Services.
HMP Haverigg is a Category C & D Training Prison, located in Millom, Cumbria.
General Practitioner (GP) provision for HMP Haverigg.

(Important note: If prison reconfiguration and reform results in prison re-roles, increase in numbers, etc., then the contract holder will be required to respond accordingly and be flexible in how operational services are to be deployed).
HMP Haverigg is a Category C & D Training Prison, located in Millom, Cumbria.

The new GP provider will be expected to carry out its service provision, while also integrate into the wider healthcare team within the prison. There are 4 other procurements for healthcare services at the moment. These services include:
— Drug & Alcohol Recovery Term Services — an integrated Psychosocial and Clinical Team,
— Pharmacy Services,
— Primary Care Dental Services,
— Mental Health Services.

INFO_ADD.P: NECS is utilising an electronic tendering system to manage this procurement and communicate with potential providers. Accordingly, there will be no hard copy documents issued to potential providers and all communications with NECS, including your tender submission, will be conducted via the portal https://www.proactisplaza.com/SupplierPortal/?CID=NECS.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Drug & Alcohol Recovery Team Provision for HMP Haverigg.

(Important note: If prison reconfiguration and reform results in prison re-roles, increase in numbers, etc., then the contract holder will be required to respond accordingly and be flexible in how operational services are to be deployed).
This is to include both Psychosocial and Clinical DART Services.
HMP Haverigg is a Category C & D Training Prison, located in Millom, Cumbria.

The new DART provider will be expected to carry out its service provision, while also integrate into the wider healthcare team within the prison. There are 4 other procurements for healthcare services at the moment. These services include:
— General Practitioner (GP) Services,
— Mental Health Services,
— Pharmacy Services,
— Primary Care Dental Services.
All services will need to be bid for separately, and are all available via the Proactis portal.

INFO_ADD.P: NECS is utilising an electronic tendering system to manage this procurement and communicate with potential providers. Accordingly, there will be no hard copy documents issued to potential providers and all communications with NECS, including your tender submission, will be conducted via the portal https://www.proactisplaza.com/SupplierPortal/?CID=NECS.

ADDRESS_CONTRACTOR.ADDRESS: 24 brenkley way, blezard business park, seaton burn

TITLE.P: NHSE239 HMP Haverigg Mental Health Services

INFO_ADD.P: The basic principles that mirror that of the Open procedure have been followed for this procurement to test the capacity, capability, and technical competence of tenderers in accordance with The Public Contracts Regulations 2015, ensuring a fair, open and transparent process in accordance with NHS (Procurement, Patient Choice and Competition) (No. 2) Regulations 2013.
Under the Public Services (Social Value) Act 2012, the contracting authority must consider:
1) How what is proposed to be procured might improve the economic, social and environmental well-being of the area where it exercises its functions;
2) How, in conducting the process of procurement, it might act with a view to securing that improvement.
Accordingly, the subject matter of the contract has been scoped to take into account the priorities of the contracting authority relating to economic, social and environmental well-being.

ADDRESS_REVIEW_BODY.OFFICIALNAME: North of England Commissioning Support Unit

REVIEW_PROCEDURE.P: The contracting authority will act in accordance with Part 3 Chapter 5 Regulation 85 to 87 and Regulation 95 of the Public Contract Regulations 2015 (SI 2015 No 102) (PCR 2015). Part 3 of the PCR 2015 provides for appeals to be made to the High Court subject to the time limitations and other required procedural steps. The rules relating to appeal are complex and a dissatisfied tenderer is advised to take their own prompt legal advice.

ADDRESS_REVIEW_INFO.OFFICIALNAME: Royal Courts of Justice — The High Court
